|cpu1chip1 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |cpu1_cores = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |cpu1_type = <!-- ARM,MIPS,x86-64,PowerPC, --> |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = <!-- CPU1 speed, MHz, GHz, Leave blank if unknown --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash1size = <!-- Size of flash --> |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = <!-- Size of RAM --> |ram1chip = Nanya;; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_none = true |oui = 00:22:C0

|exp_if_types = <!-- Expansion Interface types, Leave blank for none -->
|pwr_volt_type = <!-- VDC,VAC, or POE, --> |pwr_vdc = <!-- DC Volts --> |pwr_amp_dc = <!-- DC Amps --> |pwr_vac = <!-- AC Volts --> |pwr_ac_hz = <!-- AC Hertz --> |pwr_amp_ac = <!-- AC Amps --> |pwr_poe_type = <!-- Type of POE --> |pwr_poe = <!-- POE Volts --> |pwr_poe_amp = <!-- POE Amps --> |pwr_bat_type = |pwr_bat_v = |pwr_bat_mAh = |pwr_bat_cells = |pwr_conn = <!-- Connector Type --> |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Ralink;RT3070; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This is a small RC vehicle controllable (with a camera + mic) remotely controllable via an '''Android''' or '''iOS''' app. :The vehicle itself would seem to act as an AP - a direct connection to the device seems to be needed to control it.
"BS00006A", "2013-7-6", and "VER 2.0" is silkscreened on the bottom of the main board. :"BL-RT3070-M2" <??> and "2013.5.27" would appear to be silkscreened on the wireless module.. indicating '''B-LINK''' manufacture.
The manufacturer stated within the FCC docs is '''Guangzhou Panyu Fantasia Creation Toys Co., Ltd.'''.. which would appear to be associated with [http://www.acctron.net.cn/ '''Acctron'''] and [http://www.nano-vation.net/index.html '''Nanovation'''].
A label affixed to the device in the FCC external photos indicates the default SSID format is '''Rover3_XXXXXXXXXXXX''' ('''Rover3_''' + the presumed MAC). :The MAC shown has a 00:22:C0 ('''Shenzhen Forcelink Electronic''') OUI. It is presumed to be used...
[[Category:English Documentation]]
